text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Attorney Association accuses government of breaking constitutional model
- ETA tries to kill a prison employee in Granada
- Jospin forms government with communists and greens
- Defender of the people asks for funds so that public schools will be competitive
EL MUNDO
- Attorney association accuses (Attorney General Jesus) Cardenal of violating legality
- Gonzalez 'ready' to confront "the pack" with Barrionuevo and Vera
DIARIO 16
- Aznar laughs at attorney generals
- ETA misses
ABC
- Fear and uncertainty in markets before danger of euro delay
CINCO DIAS
- Tabacalera: end of a monopoly
- Economy Ministry has bill for full liberalisation almost ready
- Law will take affect before 1998 privatisation
- Cajamadrid invested 65 billion in bourse in April alone
EXPANSION
- Endesa refines its labour costs before sale
- Waigel yields to Bundesbank and puts off gold revaluation
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- Kohl, Bundesbank deal calms markets
- Telefonica to issue 72.5 billion in convertible bonds
- Savings banks put one-quarter billion in bourse by April
-- Madrid Newsroom, + 341 585 8340
